intro: Tabernaemontana calcicola, commonly known as the rock tabernaemontana, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its evergreen, glossy leaves and fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. Due to its ornamental value and specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
